required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Improving Diet Protein Intake in Middle-aged Women
clinical_study.official_title: Improving Diet Protein Intake in Middle-aged Women

brief_summary.textblock: The study sought to examine the effectiveness of nutrition education with and without diet coaching on dietary protein intake and muscle mass, strength and function among a group of middle-aged women.

detailed_description.textblock: The study sought to examine the effectiveness of nutrition education alone and with 10 weeks of diet coaching on dietary protein intake and muscle mass, strength and function among a group of middle-aged women.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in dietary protein intake from baseline
primary_outcome.description: Assessed changes in dietary protein intake from three 24-hour dietary recalls collected at baseline.

secondary_outcome.description: Changes in muscle mass from baseline were measured using bioelectrical impedance analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in upper body muscle strength
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in handgrip strength from baseline were measured using hand dynamometer

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in lower body muscle strength and function
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in 5-chair stand times from baseline were assessed
Changes in 4 meter gait speed from baseline were assessed

intervention.description: 10-weeks of diet coaching weekly by telephone to improve dietary protein intake

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- able to understand and respond to questions or instructions in English
- working telephone
- willingness to consume protein-containing animal products,
- willingness to make changes to the diet
Exclusion Criteria:
- self-reported information that they have been told by a medical doctor that they have kidney (renal) disease
- current or past history of a diagnosed eating disorder
- have an internal cardiac pacemaker/defibrillator or other metal-type implant present
- vegan dietary practices
- refusal to make changes to usual dietary protein intake
- usual dietary protein intake greater than 1.2 g per kg body weight

overall_official.affiliation: Professor, College of Nursing, Florida Atlantic University
